Master Mingjiao Song said: There is nothing more venerable than the Way. There is nothing more beautiful than virtue. The Way
and virtue exist.
Even an ordinary person is not poor.
Where the Way and virtue do not exist,
Even the ruler of the world is not complete.
Bo Yi and Shu Qi were starving men of the past.
Now comparing them to people,
Everyone is happy.
Jie, Zhou, You, and Li were rulers of the past.
Now comparing them to people,
Everyone is angry.
Therefore, learners suffer from the lack of the Way and virtue in their bodies,
But do not suffer from the lack of power and status in themselves.
Mingjiao said:
The learning of sages and worthies,
Is certainly not accomplished in one day.
Not enough for the day, continue with the night.
Accumulate it over the years and months,
It will naturally be accomplished.
Therefore it is said:
Learning is to gather it.
Ask questions to discern.

The Grand Historian read Mencius.
Up to King Hui of Liang asking, How can it benefit my country?
He could not help but put down the scroll and sigh long.
Alas!
Profit is truly the beginning of chaos.
Therefore, the Master rarely spoke of profit.
He always guarded against its source.
The source is the beginning.
Honoring the poor and the lowly.
The harm of liking profit.
How can it be distinguished?

Moreover, the sages deeply warned against the pursuit of profit and valued benevolence and righteousness first.
Yet in later generations, there are still those who rely on profit to deceive each other.
How many have harmed the moral character and corrupted the teachings?
Moreover, they openly establish the way of pursuing profit and practice it.
They want the customs of the world to be correct, not vulgar or shallow.
Is this possible?

All the evil things that people do,

The formless evil harms people.

Mingjiao said:
Great Awakened One Lian, the abbot of Yuwang,
because two monks were arguing over the offerings they received and would not stop,
the person in charge was unable to resolve it.
Great Awakened One called them to him.
He reprimanded them, saying:
In the past, when Bao Gong was judging in Kaifeng,
there was a person who said he had entrusted 100 taels of white gold to me, but I have passed away.
Now I am returning it to his family.

I hope the magistrate will summon his son to return it to him.

When my father was alive,

charge it to a temple or monastery in the city to perform meritorious deeds for the netherworld.
To recommend the deceased.

Moreover, a person in the dust and toil of the world

Chan Master Dajue Lian.
At first he traveled to Mount Lu.

Nuo said,
This person is upright and does not lean.
His movements are dignified.
Moreover, he has the conduct of a person of the Way.
His words are simple yet fully capture the principle.
Generally speaking, a person endowed with such qualities.
Rarely fails to become a vessel.
In the beginning of the Huangyou era of Emperor Ren Zong.
He sent a small messenger with silver earrings.
Holding a letter of green silk one chi long.
He summoned Yuantong Nuo to reside in the great monastery of Xiaoci.
Nuo claimed to be ill and did not rise.
He wrote a memorial and a letter requesting that Dajue respond to the imperial edict.
Someone said,
The sagely emperor honors and esteems morality and virtue.
His grace extends to the springs and rocks.
Why do you insist on refusing?
Nuo said,
I am a mere monk.
Their vision and hearing are not sharp.
Fortunately, they are at ease in the forest.
Eating vegetables and drinking water.
Even the buddhas and ancestors have things they do not do.
How much more so for others?
The ancient sages have said:
It is difficult to remain in a place of great fame for a long time.

I do not burden myself with fame and profit.
If there is dissatisfaction in the mind, how can it ever be enough?
Therefore, Dongpo once said:
Knowing contentment is honorable.
Knowing satisfaction is wealth.
Avoiding fame and preserving integrity.
Good beginnings and good endings.

Master Nenghai said:

One who crosses a river relies on a boat.

Yuantong Neng said:

in the degenerate age, students would steal the rules and regulations to destroy Baizhang's monastic institutions.

even though people lived in nests or holes,
everyone disciplined themselves.
After Baizhang,
even though there were lofty halls and spacious houses,
everyone was self-destructive.
Therefore it is said:
Peace and danger depend on virtue.
Prosperity and decline are determined by fate.
If virtue can be relied upon,
what need is there for monastic institutions?
If fate can be relied upon,
what need is there for rules and regulations?
Yuantong said to Dajue:

The bad can be taken as a warning.
Those who have established themselves and made a name for themselves in the present age.

Great Master Dayi said:
The principle of the wondrous Way.
The sages have always expressed it in the Book of Changes.
When the Zhou dynasty declined and the rites and righteousness of the former kings were destroyed.

When our Shakyamuni entered China.
Purely using the supreme truth to teach people.

To transform the multitude of beings.

In the past, the edicts and oaths of the Shang and Zhou dynasties,
later scholars,

listening to them and not going against them,
then the customs and the present are how they are.

unfolds it with the principle of life and death.

Heaven has four seasons that cycle,
using them to generate myriad things.
The sages established teachings to support each other.
In order to transform the world.
It is also due to this.
However, in the end,
they all cannot be without faults.
Faults are traces.
There must be sages and worthies who appear in the world to save them.
Since the Qin and Han dynasties, for more than a thousand years,
Customs have become increasingly shallow.
The teachings of the sages
are listed and stand side by side.
They criticize each other.
The great Way is vast and empty, no one returns to it.

Dajue said:
As the head of a region,

you must first be humble and kind to everyone.
Only then can you regard gold and silk as rubbish.
Then the four groups of Buddhists will respect and return to you.
Dajue said:
The predecessors had the resources of intelligence and wisdom.
Without worries about safety or danger.
Like Shimen Cong and Qixian Shun, the two of them.

Da Jue said:

Laozi Shun said,

this is the reality of conduct.
Promoting morality and virtue,
welcoming those from all directions,
this is the reality of upholding the Dharma.
Assessing talents and inviting them to take up duties,
this is the reality of employing people.

this is the reality of seeking the wise.
If one does not maintain sincerity,
vainly displaying empty fame,
it is of no benefit to the principles.
Therefore, the conduct of a person is only important to be sincere.
If one adheres to it without wavering,
even in difficult and dangerous situations, it can be made consistent. The two matters are recorded in the Anthology of the Tranquil and Peaceful Hermitage.
Laozi Shun said to the recorded sayings master of Mount Fuzhou,
If you want to investigate the supreme wonderful Way,
When exhausted, it becomes even stronger. When old, it becomes even more vigorous.

Fushan Farong said:

Master Yuan said:

Master Yuan said:

The sprouts of safety and danger are determined externally.

and danger is not the danger of one day.
They all come from accumulated gradual changes, so one must observe them.

Therefore, when morality, virtue, propriety, and righteousness are abundant, the inside and outside are happy.
When carving, scraping, and resentment reach their extreme, the inside and outside are sorrowful.
The feelings of sorrow and joy correspond to blessings and misfortunes.
Master Yuan said:
There are three essentials for upholding the Way:
Benevolence,
Wisdom,
and Courage.
The benevolent practice morality and virtue,
Promote education,
Make the superiors and inferiors at ease, and please those who come and go.
The wise follow propriety and righteousness,
Recognize what is safe and dangerous,
Examine the wise and the foolish,

The courageous accomplish their tasks decisively,

It is like having seedlings but not weeding them.
Brave but not benevolent.
Like cutting without knowing how to plant.
Third, when all three are present, the monastic community flourishes.
When one is lacking, it declines.
When two are lacking, it is in danger.
When all three are lacking,
then the way of upholding the Dharma is lost. Two matters are written in a letter to Chan Master Jingyin Zhen.
Master Yuan said:

are like water and fire not in the same vessel,
like cold and heat not in the same season.
This is their natural division.
The wise and virtuous people,
are pure, kind, upright, and sincere.
They use morality, virtue, benevolence, and righteousness as their plans.
When they speak or act,
they are afraid of not being in accord with human feelings or the principles of things.
The unworthy ones,
are deceitful, treacherous, crafty, and flattering, priding themselves and showing off their abilities.
They indulge in desires and seek profit,
not caring about anything else.
Therefore, when Chan monasteries get the virtuous ones,
their morality and virtue are cultivated,
and the rules and regulations are established.
Thus, they become Dharma seats.
If an unworthy person is among them,
In the midst of the crowd, the inside and outside are uneasy.
Even if there is great wisdom and ritual propriety, what use are they?
The wise and the foolish, the virtuous and the unvirtuous, the superior and the inferior, are like this.

They discussed with the learners in a leisurely manner, reaching everywhere.

The way should not be obstructed.

In terms of their advancement and retreat, all are in accordance with what is appropriate.

The countenance becomes respectful and the expression dignified.
